attributes.name: closable
attributes.description: Makes the alert closable.

attributes.name: duration
attributes.description:
The length of time, in milliseconds, the alert will show before closing itself. If the user interacts with
the alert before it closes (e.g. moves the mouse over it), the timer will restart. Defaults to `Infinity`.

attributes.name: open
attributes.description: Indicates whether or not the alert is open. You can use this in lieu of the show/hide methods.

attributes.name: type
attributes.description: The type of alert.

attributes.name: delay
attributes.description: The number of milliseconds to delay the start of the animation.

attributes.name: direction
attributes.description: Determines the direction of playback as well as the behavior when reaching the end of an iteration.

attributes.name: duration
attributes.description: The number of milliseconds each iteration of the animation takes to complete.

attributes.name: easing
attributes.description:
The easing function to use for the animation. This can be a Shoelace easing function or a custom easing function
such as `cubic-bezier(0, 1, .76, 1.14)`.

attributes.name: endDelay
attributes.description: The number of milliseconds to delay after the active period of an animation sequence.

attributes.name: fill
attributes.description: Sets how the animation applies styles to its target before and after its execution.

attributes.name: iterationStart
attributes.description: The offset at which to start the animation, usually between 0 (start) and 1 (end).

attributes.name: iterations
attributes.description: The number of iterations to run before the animation completes. Defaults to `Infinity`, which loops.

attributes.name: keyframes
attributes.description: The keyframes to use for the animation. If this is set, `name` will be ignored.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: The name of the built-in animation to use. For custom animations, use the `keyframes` prop.

attributes.name: pause
attributes.description: Pauses the animation. The animation will resume when this prop is removed.

attributes.name: playbackRate
attributes.description:
Sets the animation's playback rate. The default is `1`, which plays the animation at a normal speed. Setting this
to `2`, for example, will double the animation's speed. A negative value can be used to reverse the animation. This
value can be changed without causing the animation to restart.

attributes.name: alt
attributes.description: Alternative text for the image.

attributes.name: image
attributes.description: The image source to use for the avatar.

attributes.name: initials
attributes.description: Initials to use as a fallback when no image is available (1-2 characters max recommended).

attributes.name: shape
attributes.description: The shape of the avatar.

attributes.name: pill
attributes.description: Draws a pill-style badge with rounded edges.

attributes.name: pulse
attributes.description: Makes the badge pulsate to draw attention.

attributes.name: type
attributes.description: The badge's type.

attributes.name: caret
attributes.description: Draws the button with a caret for use with dropdowns, popovers, etc.

attributes.name: circle
attributes.description: Draws a circle button.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Disables the button.

attributes.name: download
attributes.description: Tells the browser to download the linked file as this filename. Only used when `href` is set.

attributes.name: href
attributes.description: When set, the underlying button will be rendered as an `<a>` with this `href` instead of a `<button>`.

attributes.name: loading
attributes.description: Draws the button in a loading state.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: An optional name for the button. Ignored when `href` is set.

attributes.name: pill
attributes.description: Draws a pill-style button with rounded edges.

attributes.name: size
attributes.description: The button's size.

attributes.name: submit
attributes.description: Indicates if activating the button should submit the form. Ignored when `href` is set.

attributes.name: target
attributes.description: Tells the browser where to open the link. Only used when `href` is set.

attributes.name: type
attributes.description: The button's type.

attributes.name: value
attributes.description: An optional value for the button. Ignored when `href` is set.

attributes.name: label
attributes.description: A label to use for the button group's `aria-label` attribute.

attributes.name: checked
attributes.description: Draws the checkbox in a checked state.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Disables the checkbox.

attributes.name: indeterminate
attributes.description: Draws the checkbox in an indeterminate state.

attributes.name: invalid
attributes.description: This will be true when the control is in an invalid state. Validity is determined by the `required` prop.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: The checkbox's name attribute.

attributes.name: required
attributes.description: Makes the checkbox a required field.

attributes.name: value
attributes.description: The checkbox's value attribute.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Disables the color picker.

attributes.name: format
attributes.description:
The format to use for the display value. If opacity is enabled, these will translate to HEXA, RGBA, and HSLA
respectively. The color picker will always accept user input in any format (including CSS color names) and convert
it to the desired format.

attributes.name: hoist
attributes.description:
Enable this option to prevent the panel from being clipped when the component is placed inside a container with
`overflow: auto|scroll`.

attributes.name: inline
attributes.description: Renders the color picker inline rather than inside a dropdown.

attributes.name: invalid
attributes.description:
This will be true when the control is in an invalid state. Validity is determined by the `setCustomValidity()`
method using the browser's constraint validation API.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: The input's name attribute.

attributes.name: noFormatToggle
attributes.description: Removes the format toggle.

attributes.name: opacity
attributes.description: Whether to show the opacity slider.

attributes.name: size
attributes.description: Determines the size of the color picker's trigger. This has no effect on inline color pickers.

attributes.name: swatches
attributes.description:
An array of predefined color swatches to display. Can include any format the color picker can parse, including
HEX(A), RGB(A), HSL(A), and CSS color names.

attributes.name: uppercase
attributes.description: By default, the value will be set in lowercase. Set this to true to set it in uppercase instead.

attributes.name: value
attributes.description: The current color.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Disables the details so it can't be toggled.

attributes.name: open
attributes.description: Indicates whether or not the details is open. You can use this in lieu of the show/hide methods.

attributes.name: summary
attributes.description: The summary to show in the details header. If you need to display HTML, use the `summary` slot instead.

attributes.name: label
attributes.description:
The dialog's label as displayed in the header. You should always include a relevant label even when using
`no-header`, as it is required for proper accessibility.

attributes.name: noHeader
attributes.description:
Disables the header. This will also remove the default close button, so please ensure you provide an easy,
accessible way for users to dismiss the dialog.

attributes.name: open
attributes.description: Indicates whether or not the dialog is open. You can use this in lieu of the show/hide methods.

attributes.name: contained
attributes.description:
By default, the drawer slides out of its containing block (usually the viewport). To make the drawer slide out of
its parent element, set this prop and add `position: relative` to the parent.

attributes.name: label
attributes.description:
The drawer's label as displayed in the header. You should always include a relevant label even when using
`no-header`, as it is required for proper accessibility.

attributes.name: noHeader
attributes.description:
Removes the header. This will also remove the default close button, so please ensure you provide an easy,
accessible way for users to dismiss the drawer.

attributes.name: open
attributes.description: Indicates whether or not the drawer is open. You can use this in lieu of the show/hide methods.

attributes.name: placement
attributes.description: The direction from which the drawer will open.

attributes.name: closeOnSelect
attributes.description: Determines whether the dropdown should hide when a menu item is selected.

attributes.name: containingElement
attributes.description: The dropdown will close when the user interacts outside of this element (e.g. clicking).

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Disables the dropdown so the panel will not open.

attributes.name: distance
attributes.description: The distance in pixels from which to offset the panel away from its trigger.

attributes.name: hoist
attributes.description:
Enable this option to prevent the panel from being clipped when the component is placed inside a container with
`overflow: auto|scroll`.

attributes.name: open
attributes.description: Indicates whether or not the dropdown is open. You can use this in lieu of the show/hide methods.

attributes.name: placement
attributes.description:
The preferred placement of the dropdown panel. Note that the actual placement may vary as needed to keep the panel
inside of the viewport.

attributes.name: skidding
attributes.description: The distance in pixels from which to offset the panel along its trigger.

attributes.name: novalidate
attributes.description: Prevent the form from validating inputs before submitting.

attributes.name: locale
attributes.description: The locale to use when formatting the number.

attributes.name: unit
attributes.description: The unit to display.

attributes.name: value
attributes.description: The number to format in bytes.

attributes.name: date
attributes.description: The date/time to format. If not set, the current date and time will be used.

attributes.name: day
attributes.description: The format for displaying the day.

attributes.name: era
attributes.description: The format for displaying the era.

attributes.name: hour
attributes.description: The format for displaying the hour.

attributes.name: hourFormat
attributes.description: When set, 24 hour time will always be used.

attributes.name: locale
attributes.description: The locale to use when formatting the date/time.

attributes.name: minute
attributes.description: The format for displaying the minute.

attributes.name: month
attributes.description: The format for displaying the month.

attributes.name: second
attributes.description: The format for displaying the second.

attributes.name: timeZone
attributes.description: The time zone to express the time in.

attributes.name: timeZoneName
attributes.description: The format for displaying the time.

attributes.name: weekday
attributes.description: The format for displaying the weekday.

attributes.name: year
attributes.description: The format for displaying the year.

attributes.name: currency
attributes.description: The currency to use when formatting. Must be an ISO 4217 currency code such as `USD` or `EUR`.

attributes.name: currencyDisplay
attributes.description: How to display the currency.

attributes.name: locale
attributes.description: The locale to use when formatting the number.

attributes.name: maximumFractionDigits
attributes.description: The maximum number of fraction digits to use. Possible values are 0 - 20.

attributes.name: maximumSignificantDigits
attributes.description: The maximum number of significant digits to use,. Possible values are 1 - 21.

attributes.name: minimumFractionDigits
attributes.description: The minimum number of fraction digits to use. Possible values are 0 - 20.

attributes.name: minimumIntegerDigits
attributes.description: The minimum number of integer digits to use. Possible values are 1 - 21.

attributes.name: minimumSignificantDigits
attributes.description: The minimum number of significant digits to use. Possible values are 1 - 21.

attributes.name: noGrouping
attributes.description: Turns off grouping separators.

attributes.name: type
attributes.description: The formatting style to use.

attributes.name: value
attributes.description: The number to format.

attributes.name: label
attributes.description: An alternative description to use for accessibility. If omitted, the name or src will be used to generate it.

attributes.name: library
attributes.description: The name of a registered custom icon library.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: The name of the icon to draw.

attributes.name: src
attributes.description: An external URL of an SVG file.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Disables the button.

attributes.name: label
attributes.description:
A description that gets read by screen readers and other assistive devices. For optimal accessibility, you should
always include a label that describes what the icon button does.

attributes.name: library
attributes.description: The name of a registered custom icon library.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: The name of the icon to draw.

attributes.name: src
attributes.description: An external URL of an SVG file.

attributes.name: position
attributes.description: The position of the divider as a percentage.

attributes.name: allowScripts
attributes.description:
Allows included scripts to be executed. You must ensure the content you're including is trusted, otherwise this
option can lead to XSS vulnerabilities in your app!

attributes.name: mode
attributes.description: The fetch mode to use.

attributes.name: src
attributes.description: The location of the HTML file to include.

attributes.name: autocapitalize
attributes.description: The input's autocaptialize attribute.

attributes.name: autocomplete
attributes.description: The input's autocomplete attribute.

attributes.name: autocorrect
attributes.description: The input's autocorrect attribute.

attributes.name: autofocus
attributes.description: The input's autofocus attribute.

attributes.name: clearable
attributes.description: Adds a clear button when the input is populated.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Disables the input.

attributes.name: helpText
attributes.description: The input's help text. Alternatively, you can use the help-text slot.

attributes.name: inputmode
attributes.description: The input's inputmode attribute.

attributes.name: invalid
attributes.description:
This will be true when the control is in an invalid state. Validity is determined by props such as `type`,
`required`, `minlength`, `maxlength`, and `pattern` using the browser's constraint validation API.

attributes.name: label
attributes.description: The input's label. Alternatively, you can use the label slot.

attributes.name: max
attributes.description: The input's maximum value.

attributes.name: maxlength
attributes.description: The maximum length of input that will be considered valid.

attributes.name: min
attributes.description: The input's minimum value.

attributes.name: minlength
attributes.description: The minimum length of input that will be considered valid.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: The input's name attribute.

attributes.name: pattern
attributes.description: A pattern to validate input against.

attributes.name: pill
attributes.description: Draws a pill-style input with rounded edges.

attributes.name: placeholder
attributes.description: The input's placeholder text.

attributes.name: readonly
attributes.description: Makes the input readonly.

attributes.name: required
attributes.description: Makes the input a required field.

attributes.name: size
attributes.description: The input's size.

attributes.name: spellcheck
attributes.description: Enables spell checking on the input.

attributes.name: step
attributes.description: The input's step attribute.

attributes.name: togglePassword
attributes.description: Adds a password toggle button to password inputs.

attributes.name: type
attributes.description: The input's type.

attributes.name: value
attributes.description: The input's value attribute.

attributes.name: checked
attributes.description: Draws the item in a checked state.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Draws the menu item in a disabled state.

attributes.name: value
attributes.description: A unique value to store in the menu item. This can be used as a way to identify menu items when selected.

attributes.name: indeterminate
attributes.description: When true, percentage is ignored, the label is hidden, and the progress bar is drawn in an indeterminate state.

attributes.name: percentage
attributes.description: The progress bar's percentage, 0 to 100.

attributes.name: percentage
attributes.description: The current progress percentage, 0 - 100.

attributes.name: size
attributes.description: The size of the progress ring in pixels.

attributes.name: strokeWidth
attributes.description: The stroke width of the progress ring in pixels.

attributes.name: background
attributes.description: The background color. This can be any valid CSS color or `transparent`, but not a CSS custom property.

attributes.name: errorCorrection
attributes.description: The level of error correction to use.

attributes.name: fill
attributes.description: The fill color. This can be any valid CSS color, but not a CSS custom property.

attributes.name: label
attributes.description: The label used when screen readers announce the code. If unspecified, the value will be used.

attributes.name: radius
attributes.description: The edge radius of each module. Must be between 0 and 0.5.

attributes.name: size
attributes.description: The size of the code's overall square in pixels.

attributes.name: value
attributes.description: The QR code's value.

attributes.name: checked
attributes.description: Draws the radio in a checked state.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Disables the radio.

attributes.name: invalid
attributes.description:
This will be true when the control is in an invalid state. Validity in range inputs is determined by the message
provided by the `setCustomValidity` method.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: The radio's name attribute.

attributes.name: value
attributes.description: The radio's value attribute.

attributes.name: label
attributes.description: The radio group label. Required for proper accessibility. Alternatively, you can use the label slot.

attributes.name: noFieldset
attributes.description: Hides the fieldset and legend that surrounds the radio group. The label will still be read by screen readers.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Disables the input.

attributes.name: helpText
attributes.description: The range's help text. Alternatively, you can use the help-text slot.

attributes.name: invalid
attributes.description:
This will be true when the control is in an invalid state. Validity in range inputs is determined by the message
provided by the `setCustomValidity` method.

attributes.name: label
attributes.description: The range's label. Alternatively, you can use the label slot.

attributes.name: max
attributes.description: The input's max attribute.

attributes.name: min
attributes.description: The input's min attribute.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: The input's name attribute.

attributes.name: step
attributes.description: The input's step attribute.

attributes.name: tooltip
attributes.description: The preferred placedment of the tooltip.

attributes.name: value
attributes.description: The input's value attribute.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Disables the rating.

attributes.name: max
attributes.description: The highest rating to show.

attributes.name: precision
attributes.description: The minimum increment value allowed by the control.

attributes.name: readonly
attributes.description: Makes the rating readonly.

attributes.name: value
attributes.description: The current rating.

attributes.name: date
attributes.description: The date from which to calculate time from.

attributes.name: format
attributes.description: The formatting style to use.

attributes.name: locale
attributes.description: The locale to use when formatting the number.

attributes.name: numeric
attributes.description:
When `auto`, values such as "yesterday" and "tomorrow" will be shown when possible. When `always`, values such as
"1 day ago" and "in 1 day" will be shown.

attributes.name: sync
attributes.description: Keep the displayed value up to date as time passes.

attributes.name: aspectRatio
attributes.description:
The aspect ratio of the embedded media in the format of `width:height`, e.g. `16:9`, `4:3`, or `1:1`. Ratios not in
this format will be ignored.

attributes.name: fit
attributes.description: Determines how content will be resized to fit its container.

attributes.name: clearable
attributes.description: Adds a clear button when the select is populated.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Disables the select control.

attributes.name: helpText
attributes.description: The select's help text. Alternatively, you can use the help-text slot.

attributes.name: hoist
attributes.description:
Enable this option to prevent the panel from being clipped when the component is placed inside a container with
`overflow: auto|scroll`.

attributes.name: invalid
attributes.description: This will be true when the control is in an invalid state. Validity is determined by the `required` prop.

attributes.name: label
attributes.description: The select's label. Alternatively, you can use the label slot.

attributes.name: maxTagsVisible
attributes.description:
The maximum number of tags to show when `multiple` is true. After the maximum, "+n" will be shown to indicate the
number of additional items that are selected. Set to -1 to remove the limit.

attributes.name: multiple
attributes.description: Enables multiselect. With this enabled, value will be an array.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: The select's name.

attributes.name: pill
attributes.description: Draws a pill-style select with rounded edges.

attributes.name: placeholder
attributes.description: The select's placeholder text.

attributes.name: required
attributes.description: The select's required attribute.

attributes.name: size
attributes.description: The select's size.

attributes.name: value
attributes.description: The value of the control. This will be a string or an array depending on `multiple`.

attributes.name: effect
attributes.description: Determines which effect the skeleton will use.

attributes.name: checked
attributes.description: Draws the switch in a checked state.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Disables the switch.

attributes.name: invalid
attributes.description: This will be true when the control is in an invalid state. Validity is determined by the `required` prop.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: The switch's name attribute.

attributes.name: required
attributes.description: Makes the switch a required field.

attributes.name: value
attributes.description: The switch's value attribute.

attributes.name: active
attributes.description: Draws the tab in an active state.

attributes.name: closable
attributes.description: Makes the tab closable and shows a close icon.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Draws the tab in a disabled state.

attributes.name: panel
attributes.description: The name of the tab panel the tab will control. The panel must be located in the same tab group.

attributes.name: activation
attributes.description:
When set to auto, navigating tabs with the arrow keys will instantly show the corresponding tab panel. When set to
manual, the tab will receive focus but will not show until the user presses spacebar or enter.

attributes.name: noScrollControls
attributes.description: Disables the scroll arrows that appear when tabs overflow.

attributes.name: placement
attributes.description: The placement of the tabs.

attributes.name: active
attributes.description: When true, the tab panel will be shown.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: The tab panel's name.

attributes.name: clearable
attributes.description: Makes the tag clearable.

attributes.name: pill
attributes.description: Draws a pill-style tag with rounded edges.

attributes.name: size
attributes.description: The tag's size.

attributes.name: type
attributes.description: The tag's type.

attributes.name: autocapitalize
attributes.description: The textarea's autocaptialize attribute.

attributes.name: autocomplete
attributes.description: The textarea's autocomplete attribute.

attributes.name: autocorrect
attributes.description: The textarea's autocorrect attribute.

attributes.name: autofocus
attributes.description: The textarea's autofocus attribute.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Disables the textarea.

attributes.name: helpText
attributes.description: The textarea's help text. Alternatively, you can use the help-text slot.

attributes.name: inputmode
attributes.description: The textarea's inputmode attribute.

attributes.name: invalid
attributes.description:
This will be true when the control is in an invalid state. Validity is determined by props such as `type`,
`required`, `minlength`, and `maxlength` using the browser's constraint validation API.

attributes.name: label
attributes.description: The textarea's label. Alternatively, you can use the label slot.

attributes.name: maxlength
attributes.description: The maximum length of input that will be considered valid.

attributes.name: minlength
attributes.description: The minimum length of input that will be considered valid.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: The textarea's name attribute.

attributes.name: pattern
attributes.description: A pattern to validate input against.

attributes.name: placeholder
attributes.description: The textarea's placeholder text.

attributes.name: readonly
attributes.description: Makes the textarea readonly.

attributes.name: required
attributes.description: Makes the textarea a required field.

attributes.name: resize
attributes.description: Controls how the textarea can be resized.

attributes.name: rows
attributes.description: The number of rows to display by default.

attributes.name: size
attributes.description: The textarea's size.

attributes.name: spellcheck
attributes.description: Enables spell checking on the textarea.

attributes.name: value
attributes.description: The textarea's value attribute.

attributes.name: content
attributes.description: The tooltip's content. Alternatively, you can use the content slot.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Disables the tooltip so it won't show when triggered.

attributes.name: distance
attributes.description: The distance in pixels from which to offset the tooltip away from its target.

attributes.name: open
attributes.description: Indicates whether or not the tooltip is open. You can use this in lieu of the show/hide methods.

attributes.name: placement
attributes.description:
The preferred placement of the tooltip. Note that the actual placement may vary as needed to keep the tooltip
inside of the viewport.

attributes.name: skidding
attributes.description: The distance in pixels from which to offset the tooltip along its target.

attributes.name: trigger
attributes.description:
Controls how the tooltip is activated. Possible options include `click`, `hover`, `focus`, and `manual`. Multiple
options can be passed by separating them with a space. When manual is used, the tooltip must be activated
programmatically.
